user_message:
<misra_rule>
MISRA C 2023 Rule 8.13 is: A pointer should point to a const-qualified type whenever possible.

</misra_rule>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- is_rule_violated: whether the rule is violated or not (true/false),
- scenario: a specific violation scenario.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of connection_check_timedout:
```c
static bool
connection_check_timedout (struct MHD_Connection *c)
{
  const uint64_t timeout = c->connection_timeout_ms;
  uint64_t now;
  uint64_t since_actv;

  if (c->suspended)
    return false;
  if (0 == timeout)
    return false;
  now = MHD_monotonic_msec_counter ();
  since_actv = now - c->last_activity;
  /* Keep the next lines in sync with #connection_get_wait() to avoid
   * undesired side-effects like busy-waiting. */
  if (timeout < since_actv)
  {
    if (UINT64_MAX / 2 < since_actv)
    {
      const uint64_t jump_back = c->last_activity - now;
      /* Very unlikely that it is more than quarter-million years pause.
       * More likely that system clock jumps back. */
      if (5000 >= jump_back)
      {
#ifdef HAVE_MESSAGES
        MHD_DLOG (c->daemon,
                  _ ("Detected system clock %u milliseconds jump back.\n"),
                  (unsigned int) jump_back);
#endif
        return false;
      }
#ifdef HAVE_MESSAGES
      MHD_DLOG (c->daemon,
                _ ("Detected too large system clock %" PRIu64 " milliseconds "
                   "jump back.\n"),
                jump_back);
#endif
    }
    return true;
  }
  return false;
}
```
</target_code>
<target_code>
Here is the code fragment that you need to analyze:
```c
const uint64_t timeout = c->connection_timeout_ms;
```
Focus on the above code fragment and judge whether it violates the rule 8.13 or not.
</target_code>
scenario: No violation: the declaration declares a const uint64_t variable, not a pointer. MISRA C 2023 Rule 8.13 concerns pointer types (pointer should point to const-qualified type when possible), so it is not applicable to this fragment. (If you intended to assess the parameter 'struct MHD_Connection *c', that is a separate pointer declaration outside the given fragment.)
